intro: Ruschia mesklipensis, commonly known as the Mesklipensis Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Ruschia mesklipensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and attractive foliage.
